intro: Gaura bracteata, commonly known as the pink gaura, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Gaura bracteata is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
